page.title: 11PARISH COUNCILS.
page.content: {GARBOLDISHAM.} The Council of seven is elected for a four year term and holds public {MEETINGS}every six weeks, either at the village hall or Jubilee pavilion. By prior arrangement, residents may raise specific issues, with the meeting temporarily closed and not minuted. An{ANNUAL PUBLIC MEETING}is held, usually in May, when a guest speaker talks on a matter of public interest and individuals responsible to the council present verbal annual reports. {BLO'NORTON. The Council has a total establish- ment of six plus the Parish Clerk. At present there is one vacancy.{ {MEETINGS,}on a monthly basis, take place in the village hall in summer and at members' homes in the winter.
